result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sonya R. Shosie

records.addlTxt: Stipulated agreement to convert defendant's cash bond to a signature bond to participate in the vivitrol program
Bond Motion set for 11/9/2022 at 1:45 pm.
to Modify Bond filed by Attny T. Young
Participation letter written by Edward Hartnell and filed by Defense Attny T. Young

9:52 AM 
Defendant Sonya R. Shosie in court and in-custody.
Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Sonya R. Shosie.
Attorney Rosa Delgado in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
22CF944 & 22CF949:
Victim rights compliance. 
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time, def. looking into the Vivitrol Program.
Def. moved for bond motion; denied, atty to file a bond motion.
State has made an offer in this matter.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

135PM
State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to br 4.    Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued. DE motion to modify bond- arguments heard. Court denies motion today. ec
to Modify Bond filed by Atty Young.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Sonya R. Shosie, appeared.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

216PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Alyssah Foster.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No drug paraphenalia

203PM  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody but no appearance - COVID positive.  Attorney Chad Shamali appeared.  Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm. $2000 Temporary Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
